summary: This bill, the Protecting Air Ambulance Services for Americans Act of 2025, addresses Medicare payments for air ambulance services. It empowers the Secretary of Health and Human Services to revise the fee schedule based on data collected, including operational costs, utilization, and revenue. It mandates the finalization of data collection rules and requires a Government Accountability Office (GAO) study on air ambulance costs and payment adequacy within one year of data collection commencement. The goal is to improve the Medicare payment system for these critical services.
